feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued June 27 at 3:16PM AKDT until June 28 at 9:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 9 AM AKDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Gustavus, Elfin Cove, Klawock, Craig, Ketchikan, and Metlakatla. * WHEN...From 2 AM to 9 AM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous conditions due to low visibility.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 27 at 1:58PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...POTENTIAL FLOODING OF AREA RIVERS DUE TO ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES... Very warm and well above normal temperatures are expected to continue into mid week. These near record high temperatures will increase snow and ice melt and subsequent water-levels of area rivers including the Chilkat, Klehini, and Taiya.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued June 27 at 3:01PM HST until June 28 at 6:00AM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR ALL SOUTH FACING SHORES... .The recent long period south swell is maintaining advisory level surf along many southern coasts today. Although this swell is falling today, another swell pulse from the south should keep south shore surf elevated to near advisory heights into and possibly through Tuesday.

entry.summary: ...Locally Dense Fog Through Early Morning... Locally dense fog will occur through early morning with visibility reduced to a quarter mile or less at times. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 9:32PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Galveston, northeastern Brazoria and southeastern Harris Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 932 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near San Leon, or near Kemah, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 9:29PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Webb County through 1015 PM CDT... At 929 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles northeast of Ranchitos Las Lomas, or 21 miles west of Freer, moving west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 9:20PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...An outflow boundary with gusty northerly winds from thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Kenedy, northern Jim Hogg and northern Brooks Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 918 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary with gusty northerly winds from thunderstorms along a line extending from near Benavides to near Malaquite Beach. Movement was south at 25 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 5:58PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: Nearly stationary isolated showers and thunderstorms will continue to pop up across portions of Albany and western Laramie counties through sunset. Some of these showers and thunderstorms will produce wind gusts up to 55 mph. Those traveling with lightweight and high profile vehicles should use extra caution.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Laramie County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
